name: Lord Wolseley
description:
The Lord Wolseley Hotel is also one of the oldest and smallest pubs in Sydney and certainly one of the most original. It has operated non-stop since 1881. We have great food and basic, clean and spacious accommodation at very reasonable rates.

We have queen ensuite rooms as well as queen and twin-single rooms with shared bathroom facilities. There is a bathroom for every non-ensuite room

We are happy to offer 15% off food and beverage from our bar and restaurant for all guests for the entire duration of their stay.

Free Hi-speed WiFi in every room. All rooms have ceiling fans, and large opening windows

While we do have a kitchenettes for guests on both floors of accommodation - the facilities are limited to toasters, microwaves and kettles.

We are also only several minutes walk from Sydney's world famous Chinatown , which boasts affordable dining options from all over the world.

There is a picturesque cliff-top park one-minute walk away that has free public barbecue/cooking facilities - and great sunset views!

Our restaurant serves affordable and delicious meals for lunch and dinner Wednesday through to Sunday. Our ground floor public bar closes at midnight at the latest and is open 7 days.

The Lord Wolseley is a hotel that competes with hostels on price point. Although the only large common areas for guests are the bar, restaurant (and park-side seating), it is a great place to relax and meet other guests and local people.

We also have some of Australia's best jazz musicians play in the park every Sunday afternoon (weather permitting).

LOCATION:

We are conveniently located near Chinatown and Central Station (Sydney's main train station) in a quiet and leafy part of historic Ultimo, adjacent to a park. Darling Harbour is a 5 minute walk away and colourful Glebe, with its markets and cafes is a ten minute stroll.

Also nearby are Surry Hills, Darlinghurst and Newtown; famous for nightlife, cafes and restaurants. Once you have seen the major attractions our staff can give local advice that isn't in the guide books.

RECEPTION OPENING HOURS:

Monday - Saturday : 11:30am - 11:30pm

Sunday: 11.30pm - 10pm

CHECK IN: 1pm
CHECK OUT: 10am

TRAVEL FROM AIRPORT TIPS:

Unless you are traveling solo the most cost effective way of getting here is by taxi.

houseRules.notes:
Check out is at 10am. Guests late in checking out may result in 1 night accommodation being charged to the credit card details supplied above.

PLEASE BE AWARE; that because our reception closes at midnight (and 10pm on Sundays), if your flight lands within 1.5 hours of reception closing, you should definitely catch a taxi, as it will be cheaper than arranging a late check-in if you are late.

RECEPTION OPENING HOURS:

Monday - Friday: 10:30am - Midnight
Saturday 11:30am - Midnight
Sunday: 11.30pm - 10pm

Cancellation must be received 24 hours prior to the scheduled check in time (12pm, AEST). Should notice of cancellation not be received within the above time period, 1 night accommodation (based on quoted room rate) will be charged to the credit card details supplied above.
